page.title: 18A SOURCE OF COTSWOLD STONE
page.content: The area is dotted with the sites of old quarries,where the natural{limestone was excavated}to build field walls & farm buildings,but the only working quarry is situated at Knockdown. Planning regulations stipulate that work on scheduled buildings should be carried out in natural stone wherever possible,so there is still a{good {market}for the product. Where excavation has taken place the pit is available for infilling ,it is much in demand for{tipping}hard_ core & general rubbish by local building firms & householders.At Â£20 a lorry load this is a good source of income for the owner_a local farmer.
